ygData.subject: Re: Error 1001
ygData.msgSnippet: Yeah. Tradewars finally come of age. I was a big trade warrior back in the mid-80 s. I and two co-conspirators once held the game hostage. We gained enough
ygData.messageBody:
Yeah. Tradewars finally come of age. I was a big trade warrior back
in the mid-80's. I and two co-conspirators once held the game
hostage. We gained enough resources to fabricate a sufficient number
of fighters to surround the entry point zones. No one could get out
of the entry zones after dying without being overcome by our forces.
The bbs owner finally restarted the game with significant changes.
Increased the npc ship production rate enormously to keep evil
overlord types too busy to pull such a stunt.

Sadly, my system crashed and I spent the following decade actually
interacting with people. Never learned how to overcome the new
challenge.

Glad to be back in the cyberworld, even with present problems.

Barto



--- In EverQuest@y..., "Biltilie Dwimmerlaik" <biltilie@m...> wrote:
> On 11 Oct 2002 at 13:40, mlockridge01 wrote:
>
> > Thinking Earth and Beyond looks promising. Wrote the techs for
> > support.
>
> i played EnB in the last beta phase for about two weeks, and i must
> say, if i wouldn't have four EQ accounts, i would have added EnB.
but
> another additional two accounts paying $12 or $13 for each of them
> was too much for me.
>
> i tried AO (Anarchy Online) and Neocron as well, but somehow i liked
> EnB most of the future settings ... maybe because it is sort of an
> "Elite" or "Tradewars" game with many interesting ideas. actually i
> found some UO, ans many EQ and DAoC players in EnB.
>
>
> - bilt
>
> --
> Biltilie Dwimmerlaik
> level 54 female gnome magician
> Tarew Marr
